The #1 thing I‚Äôve heard from voters is that they‚Äôre worried about their kids and their grandkids, and they‚Äôre ready for a new generation of conservative leadership. No one wants a rematch between the names of the past.

Yes, I saw President Trump‚Äôs Truth Social post. It‚Äôs an unfortunate move by his campaign advisors, I don‚Äôt think friendly fire is helpful. Donald Trump was the greatest President of the 21st century, and I‚Äôm not going to criticize him in response to this late attack.  I‚Äôve met tens of thousands of Iowans across 390+ events here, and they are deeply worried - and so am I - that this ‚Äúsystem‚Äù won‚Äôt allow Donald J. Trump anywhere near the White House again. It seems they will stop at *nothing* to keep him away from power.  I‚Äôm worried for Trump. I‚Äôm worried for our country. I‚Äôve stood up against the persecutions against Trump, and I‚Äôve defended him at every step. I showed up at the Miami courthouse in solidarity following his first federal indictment. I filed a FOIA demand to the Biden DOJ. I submitted an amicus brief this week with the U.S. Supreme Court calling on them to overturn Colorado‚Äôs ruling. I pledged to remove myself from Maine‚Äôs & Colorado‚Äôs primary ballots if they remove Trump, calling on DeSantis and Haley to do the same.  But we have to open our eyes. Last time it was a man-made pandemic & Big Tech election interference. Now, the same billionaires funding the lawsuits against Trump are the ones trying to prop up Nikki Haley. The same MSM blasting Trump is lavishing praise on Nikki. They want to narrow this to a two-horse race between Trump & Haley, eliminate Trump (one way or other), & trot their puppet into the White House.  We can‚Äôt fall for that trap. 1 year from now, we won‚Äôt look back and say we were shocked that it happened. We‚Äôll kick ourselves for not stopping it.  Our movement must live on. America-First didn‚Äôt start in 2016. It started in 1776. We owe it to our Founding Fathers to do the right thing for our country. I want to save Trump & to save this country. Let‚Äôs do it together. You won‚Äôt hear any friendly fire from me.

After much thought and consideration, I think I‚Äôm finally decided what I‚Äôm going to do for the 2024 election.   As an independent, my vote always goes to who I think represents me best, not a party, and not the ‚Äúlessor of two evils.‚Äù   4 years ago I volunteered for the Jo Jorgensen campaign because she best represented my views, but after the disastrous last few years, it‚Äôs becoming more and more apparent that the Libertarian path is too far from making a real impact. I know and respect each of the main candidates running, and I wish the elections were fair and that America was ready to give them a shot.   Unfortunately, that‚Äôs not the case, and there‚Äôs a candidate in another party that has risen to the occasion for me.   I met this candidate a few months ago, and not only did I think he was sincere then, but he also made a promise to my friend to free her son on day 1. He then proceeded to make that same promise publicly when I asked him in a Q&A. I believed him then. I still believe him now.  (Free Ross!)  This week I saw him work around the clock, brave insane weather conditions, and answer everyone‚Äôs questions, even those who went to the event to call him out. He treats people with respect, is willing to go on all podcasts regardless of ideology, and he‚Äôs willing to have real, meaningful conversations, plus he‚Äôs young enough (plus has two very young kids) that I know that he‚Äôs just as concerned about the future as I am. (He‚Äôs got skin in the game!)   I will be registering to vote as a Republican, and my vote has been secured by @VivekGRamaswamy.   I‚Äôm no longer on the fence, I‚Äôm going all in.   #Vivek2024
